huji.ac.il.stick_defence

Class Sprite

  • java.lang.Object
    • huji.ac.il.stick_defence.Sprite

  • public class Sprite
extends java.lang.Object
    This class represents a sprite animation object

      Represents left or right PLAYER
      static class  Sprite.Point
      This class represents a point in the (x,y) cartesian system.

    • Method Detail

      • initSprite

        public void initSprite(Bitmap bitmap,
              int nFrames,
              Sprite.Player player,
              double screenHeightPortion)
        Initialize the sprite. Must be called after construct.
        Parameters:
        bitmap - the bitmap of the sprite
        nFrames - the number of frames in the sprite
        player - left or right PLAYER
        screenHeightPortion - sprite height in relation to the screen height. 0-1 double. For instance, 0.5 will cause the sprite to span over a half of the screen height.

      • mirrorBitmap

        public static Bitmap mirrorBitmap(Bitmap src)
        Mirror bitmap.
        Parameters:
        src - the bitmap to mirror
        Returns:
        a mirrored bitmap

      • setAnimationSpeed

        public void setAnimationSpeed(int fps)
        Sets the animation speed (fps)
        Parameters:
        fps - the fps

      • update

        public void update(long gameTime)
        Update the sprite. if enough time as been passed since the last update, the sprite will load the next frame.
        Parameters:
        gameTime - the current time in milliseconds

      • render

        public void render(Canvas canvas,
          int x,
          int y)
        Draws the sprite on the canvas in the given point. the sprite will be drawn from the top left.
        Parameters:
        canvas - the canvas
        x - the x axis
        y - the y axis

      • setScaleDownFactor

        public void setScaleDownFactor(double scale)
        Set the scale factor of the bitmap. if the bitmap is big and you want it to appear small, set a high scale factor.
        Parameters:
        scale - the amount of scale

      • getScaledFrameHeight

        public double getScaledFrameHeight()
        Get the actual height of the sprite frame after scaling
        Returns:
        height of frame in pixels

      • getScaledFrameWidth

        public double getScaledFrameWidth()
        Get the actual width of the sprite frame after scaling
        Returns:
        width of frame in pixels

        public void setPic(Bitmap bitmap,
          int nFrames)
